content.description: Fun climbing on golden knobs with a cool roof crack finish. First pitch is great by itself and only 5.6/7.
content.protection: Pro to 3", bolts. 2-bolt anchors on top of pitch 1 & 2 (180', 70'), then a 1-bolt, 1-fixed-nut anchor over left 90' off the deck for rap with single 60m.
content.location: Green line on area pic - the little dot in the midst of the line is a climber (George Ridgley) leading the first pitch about 40' below the p1 anchor.

content.description: First pitch is fun and good by itself, a small corner coming out of the initial dihedral of Galadriel, similar climbing (but much easier) to the crux dihedral of Spook Book at the Needles. Tricky, thin pro, somewhat heads-up. Second pitch is runout and VERY reachy traversing along the lip of the roof, and this pitch may be a lot harder if you're shorter than 6'.
content.protection:
Pro to 3", include good selection of small gear. 2-bolt anchor on top of pitch 1 (180' pitch from top of 4th class approach ledge), 2 pro bolts pitch 2.

2010 edit: Jon reminded me that I used a 1/4" bolt for the second pro bolt - I will try to upgrade it next summer...

content.description: Old-school line up the left side of the Nazgul wall.

climbs.name: Andor
climbs.fa: Chris Gay, Rebecca Church, Brandon Adams

content.protection:
2 ea  .5"-2" (black totem-yellow C4)

000 C3, micro nuts, and medium nuts optional

many alpine draws
content.location: Approach as you would Galadriel, hiking up and right past Drug Dome until you reach series of low angle slabs, move around these to your right until you reach a boulder strewn drainage.  When the drainage nearly levels off, hike up and left to the base of The Nazgul Wall. Hike down and left along the base until you cross over a 6" dyke.  Walk out onto the largest sloping ledge to "Akallabeth Ravine".
